meanings.definition: To attach or fix a hinge to something again.
meanings.sent1: I had to rehinge the door after it fell off.
meanings.sent2: She carefully rehinged the cabinet door to make it close properly.
meanings.sent3: The handyman had to rehinge the gate after the wind blew it off.
meanings.sent4: He rehinged his broken heart after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic skillfully rehinged the car door to make it work smoothly.

meanings.definition: To put a hinge back in its original position.
meanings.sent1: He needed to rehinge the window after it got stuck.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter had to rehinge the cabinet door to make it swing properly.
meanings.sent3: The robot had to rehinge its arm to pick up the object.
meanings.sent4: She had to rehinge her thoughts to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The old door creaked as she tried to rehinge it back into place.

meanings.definition: To restore the ability to hinge or pivot.
meanings.sent1: The oil helped rehinge the rusty gate so it could swing smoothly.
meanings.sent2: He had to rehinge the squeaky chair to make it more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor taught her students how to rehinge their bodies for better flexibility.
meanings.sent4: The therapist helped him rehinge his mindset to be more positive.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic rehinged the wobbly table leg to make it stable again.
